framework-name.description: The framework name to register with Mesos.

host.description: The host that Jenkins agents will use to connect back to the master.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Jenkins master.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each Jenkins master.

mesos-master.description: URI of this cluster's Mesos master.

host-volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting Jenkins configuration and build data. The final location will be derived from this value plus the name set in `framework-name` (e.g. `/mnt/host_volume/jenkins`). Note that this path must be the same on all DCOS agents.

jvm-opts.description: Optional arguments to pass to the JVM.

known-hosts.description: A space-separated list of hosts used to populate the SSH known hosts file on the Jenkins master.

slave-image.description: The Docker image to run Jenkins slaves in. See the dind-agent documentation for information on how to extend this. This can changed via the Jenkins UI too.]
